data.text: “Think also about ◄crocodiles/great sea dragons►.
Can you put ropes through their noses to control them
Will they plead with you to act mercifully toward them
Will they make an agreement with you to work for you,
Can you cause them to become pets like you cause birds to become your pets?
Will merchants try to buy them in the market?
Can you pierce their skins by throwing fishing spears at them?
If you grab one of them with your hands, it will fight you in a way that you will never forget,
It is useless to try to subdue them.
No one dares/tries to ◄arouse them/cause them to be angry►.
Also, everything on the earth is mine.
I will tell you about how strong crocodiles' legs are
◄Can anyone strip off their hides?/No one is able to strip off their hides.► [RHQ]
◄Can anyone pry open their jaws, which have terrible teeth in them?/No one can pry open their jaws, which have terrible teeth in them!► [RHQ]
They have rows of scales on their back
The scales are very close together,
The scales are joined very closely to each other,
When crocodiles sneeze, the tiny drops of water that come out of their noses sparkle in the sunlight.
It is as though sparks of fire pour out of their mouths [DOU].
Smoke pours out of their nostrils/noses
Their breath can cause coals to blaze,
Their necks are very strong;
The folds in their flesh are very close together
They are fearless, because
When they rise up, they cause even very strong people to be terrified.
People [PRS] cannot injure them with swords,
They certainly are not afraid of weapons made of straw or rotten wood,
Shooting arrows at them does not cause them to run away.
They are not afraid of clubs any more than they would be afraid of men throwing bits of straw at them,
Their bellies are covered with scales that are as sharp as broken pieces of pottery.
They stir up the water and cause it to foam
As they go through the water, the ◄wakes/trails in the water behind them► glisten.
There are no creatures on earth that are as fearless as crocodiles.
They are the proudest of all the creatures;
